frameDefinitions: A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
This frame refers to clothing and its characteristics,  including anything that people conventionally wear.
This frame contains words that denote Kinship relations.
Words in this frame name the different parts of the calendric cycle, both man-made and natural.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
frameExamples: Claudia dressed in a dark green cotton <t>DRESS</t> clasped round her slender waist with a broad yellow belt , drank a cup of coffee and opened her neglected post .
Jo's mother will visit on this coming <t>Tuesday</t>.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
This role identifes the clothing worn.
The person who fills the role named by the Kinship term with respect to the <fen>Ego</fen>.
The person from whose perspective the Kinship relationship is defined.
<fen>Relative_time</fen> is used for the word or words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point.
<fen>Whole</fen> is used for the larger unit of which the target word names a part.
The calendric unit that is denoted. LUs in this frame all denote the <fen>Unit</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Jo's mother will visit <fex> this coming</fex> Tuesday.
Jo fled in the early morning <fex>of  Sunday December 15</fex>.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
